sen.j: アワビ（鮑、鰒、蚫、英名 abalone）は、ミミガイ科の巻貝の総称。
sen.e: Awabi (abalone) is a collective term referring to snails classified as Haliotidae.
Awabi (abalone) is a collective term referring to mollusks classified as Haliotidae.
Awabi (abalone) is a collective term referring to mollusks classified as Haliotidae.

sen.j: フランス語でオルモー（ormeau）。
sen.e: It is called "ormeau" in French.
It is called "ormeau" in French.
It is called "ormeau" in French.

sen.j: またアワビ属をHaliotisではなくてNordotisとしている図鑑もある。
sen.e: Some pictorial books refer to awabi as Nordotis, not as Haliotis.
Some illustrated encyclopedia refer to awabi as Nordotis, not as Haliotis.
Some illustrated encyclopedia refer to awabi as Nordotis, not as Haliotis.

sen.j: 雌雄の判別は外見からではほぼ不可能で、肝ではなく生殖腺の色で見分ける。
sen.e: It is almost impossible to discern male from female by appearance, so you must look at the color of sexual glands, not of livers, to tell the sex of awabi.
It is almost impossible to discern male from female by appearance alone, and the gender is determined by examining the color of the sexual glands rather than the liver.
sen.cmt: Changed for clarity. The reference to liver is puzzling. If this is the way to determine the sex of similar creatures this should be explained in the text I think.
sen.e: It is almost impossible to discern male from female by appearance alone, and the gender is determined by examining the color of the sexual glands rather than the liver.

sen.j: 生殖腺が緑のものがオスで、白っぽいものがメスである。
sen.e: Male has a green gland, and female has a whitish one.
Males have a green gland, and females a whitish one.
Males have a green gland, and females have a whitish one.
sen.cmt: femalesの後にhaveを挿入しました。

sen.j: 成長したアワビの殻は長径5cmから20cm、短径3cmから17cm程度のおおよそ楕円形である。
sen.e: When grown up, awabi has an almost elliptical shell with the major axis of 5 to 20cm and the minor one of 3 to 17cm.
Adult awabi have an almost elliptical shell with a diameter at the longest point of 5 to 20cm, and 3 to 17cm across.
Adult awabi have an almost elliptical shell with a diameter at the longest point of 5 to 20cm, and 3 to 17cm across.

sen.j: 形状は種により大きく異なるが、皿状の殻をもつ点では共通する。
sen.e: The shape differs greatly according to species, but all the species of awabi have dished shells.
The shape differs greatly according to species, but all species of awabi have dish-shaped shells.
The shape differs greatly according to species, but all species of awabi have dish-shaped shells.

sen.j: 東アジアでは日本の北海道南部から九州、朝鮮半島および中華人民共和国北部の干潮帯付近から水深20m程の岩礁に生息し、アラメ、ワカメ、コンブなどの褐藻類を食べている。
sen.e: In East Asia, awabi is found in areas between the ebb tide line and shore reefs about 20m below the surface of the sea in southern Hokkaido and Kyushu of Japan, Korean Peninsula and northern China, living on Phaeophyceae such as Eisenia bicyclis, wakame seaweeds and kelp.

In East Asia awabi are found in areas between the ebb tide line and shore reefs about 20m below the surface of the sea, they can be seen from southern Hokkaido to Kyushu in Japan, and along the Korean Peninsula and northern China, and live on Phaeophyceae such as Eisenia bicyclis, wakame seaweeds and kelp.
sen.cmt: Changed for clarity, grammar, word choice.
sen.e: In East Asia awabi are found in areas between the ebb tide line and shore reefs about 20m below the surface of the sea, they can be seen from southern Hokkaido to Kyushu in Japan, and along the Korean Peninsula and northern China, and live on Phaeophyceae such as Eisenia bicyclis, wakame seaweeds and kelp.

sen.j: 主に夜行性の物が多く、日中は岩の間や砂の中に潜っている。
sen.e: Many species of awabi are active at night, and burrow themselves between rocks or into the sand in the daytime.
Many species of awabi are active at night, and burrow between rocks or into the sand during daylight hours.
Many species of awabi are active at night, and burrow between rocks or into the sand during daylight hours.

sen.j: 産卵時期は北海道の8-9月から房総半島の11-12月と地域差がある。
sen.e: They lay eggs in different times of the year according to areas; August and September in Hokkaido, and November and December in the Boso Peninsula.
They lay eggs at different times of the year according to the area; August and September in Hokkaido, and November and December in the Boso Peninsula.
They lay eggs at different times of the year according to the area; August and September in Hokkaido, and November and December in the Boso Peninsula.

sen.j: アワビの殻の背面には数個の穴が並んでいる。
sen.e: There are several holes lining on the back surface of awabi's shells.
Awabi have a line of several holes on the back surface of the shell.
Awabi have a line of several holes on the back surface of the shell.

sen.j: この穴はえら呼吸のために外套膜に吸い込んだ水や排泄物、卵や精子を放出するためのものであるが、殻の成長に従って順次形成された穴は古いものからふさがっていき、常に一定の範囲の数の穴が開いている。
sen.e: These holes are used to discharge excrement, eggs and sperm as well as water inhaled into the mantle in the process of branchial respiration, and the number of the holes is always within a certain range because an oldest hole is clogged up as a new hole is created according to the growth of the shell.

These holes are used to discharge excrement, eggs and sperm as well as water inhaled into the mantle in the process of branchial respiration, and the number of the holes is always within a certain range as the oldest hole becomes clogged up as a new hole is created during the growth of the shell.

These holes are used to discharge excrement, eggs and sperm as well as water inhaled into the mantle in the process of branchial respiration, and the number of the holes is always within a certain range as the oldest hole becomes clogged up as a new hole is created during the growth of the shell.

sen.j: アワビではこの穴が4-5個なのに対し、トコブシでは6-8個の穴が開いている。
sen.e: While awabi has four or five holes, tokobushi (Haliotis diversicolor aquatilis) has six to eight.
While awabi have four or five holes, tokobushi (Haliotis diversicolor aquatilis) have six to eight.
While awabi have four or five holes, tokobushi (Haliotis diversicolor aquatilis) have six to eight.

sen.j: また、アワビでは穴の周囲が富士山の噴火口のように盛り上がっており穴の直径も大きいのに対し、トコブシでは穴の周囲は盛り上がらず、それほど大きくは開かない。
sen.e: In addition, while awabi has large-diameter holes with an elevated edge just like a crator of Mt. Fuji, tokobushi's holes have no such elevated edge around them and are not so large.

In addition, while awabi have large-diameter holes with an elevated edge similar in appearance to the crater of Mt. Fuji, the holes on a tokobushi have no such elevated edge around them and are not so large.

In addition, while awabi have large-diameter holes with an elevated edge similar in appearance to the crater of Mt. Fuji, the holes on a tokobushi have no such elevated edge around them and are not so large.

sen.j: 鮮魚
sen.e: Fresh fish
Fresh awabi
Fresh awabi

sen.j: アワビは高級食材で、コリコリした歯ざわりが特徴。
sen.e: Awabi is an expensive ingredient characterized by a tough, crunchy touch.
Awabi is an expensive ingredient characterized by a firm, almost crunchy texture.
Awabi is an expensive ingredient characterized by a firm, almost crunchy texture.

sen.j: 刺身、水貝、酒蒸し、ステーキ、粥などに調理される。
sen.e: It is cooked into sashimi, mizugai (sliced sea-ear served in cold water), sake steamed sea-ear, steak and rice gruel.
It is used in a variety of ways, being made into sashimi, mizugai (sliced sea-ear served in cold water), sake steamed sea-ear, steak and rice gruel.
It is used in a variety of ways, being made into sashimi, mizugai (sliced sea-ear served in cold water), sake steamed sea-ear, steak and rice gruel.

sen.j: 取れたての生きの良いアワビを磯焼きにして賞味する地方もある。
sen.e: In some areas, awabi is roasted when freshly fished.
In some areas, awabi are grilled when freshly caught.
In some areas, awabi are grilled when freshly caught.

sen.j: また地方によっては、アワビの肝も珍味として食べられる。
sen.e: In other areas, awabi's liver is appreciated as a delicacy.
In other areas, awabi liver is appreciated as a delicacy.
In other areas, awabi liver is appreciated as a delicacy.

sen.j: これらで最も高価なアワビはクロアワビと言われている。
sen.e: The most expensive awabi of all is said to be kuroawabi, or disk abalone (Nordotis discus).
The most expensive awabi of all is said to be kuroawabi, or disk abalone (Nordotis discus).
The most expensive awabi of all is said to be kuroawabi, or disk abalone (Nordotis discus).

sen.j: また、クロアワビのステーキなどで名を上げるシェフも多く、日本版西洋料理として紹介されている。
sen.e: A lot of chefs get famous for the steak of kuroawabi, which is introduced as a Japanese-style western dish.
Many chefs become famous for their kuroawabi steak, which is often presented as a Japanese-style western dish.
Many chefs become famous for their kuroawabi steak, which is often presented as a Japanese-style western dish.

sen.j: 変わったところでは、塩で硬く締めたアワビの肉を下ろし金で摩り下ろし、同量のとろろと合わせた「鮑のとろろ汁」と言う料理が存在する（小泉武夫氏の著作『奇食珍食』に詳しい記述がある）。
sen.e: One of the most unique dishes is a "yam soup of awabi," awabi salted tight, grated and mixed with the same amount of grated yam (which is explained in detail in "Strange Food and Curious Food" written by Takeo Koizumi).

One of the most unique dishes is "awabi yam soup", which is salted awabi, grated and mixed with the same amount of grated yam (this is explained in detail in "Strange Food and Curious Food" written by Takeo Koizumi).

One of the most unique dishes is 'awabi yam soup', which is salted awabi, grated and mixed with the same amount of grated yam (this is explained in detail in "Strange Food and Curious Food" written by Takeo Koizumi).
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を" "に変更しました。

sen.j: 南アメリカに生息するアッキガイ科のロコガイ（チリアワビ）やスカシガイ科のラパス貝（ラパ貝）は、食感がアワビにやや似ているため、アワビの代用品として輸入・加工されることがあるが、これらの貝は分類学的にはアワビとは全く異なる種である。
sen.e: Concholepas concholepas (Muricidae) and grand keyhole limpet (Diodora) living in South America, which taste a little like awabi, are sometimes imported and processed as an alternative to awabi, but they are taxonomically quite different from awabi.

Concholepas concholepas (Muricidae) and the grand keyhole limpet (Diodora), native to South America, taste a little like awabi and are sometimes imported and processed as an alternative to them, but they are taxonomically quite different from awabi.

Concholepas concholepas (Muricidae) and the grand keyhole limpet (Diodora), native to South America, taste a little like awabi and are sometimes imported and processed as an alternative to them, but they are taxonomically quite different from awabi.

sen.j: 干し鮑
sen.e: Dried abalone
Dried abalone
Dried abalone

sen.j: 中華料理ではアワビをゆでてから干したものを乾鮑（ガンパオ）とよび、大きいものはたいへん高価でかつ珍重される。
sen.e: Boiled and dried awabi is called ganbao in Chinese food, and large pieces of ganbao are very expensive and much-prized.
Boiled and dried awabi is called ganbao in Chinese cuisine, and large pieces of ganbao are very expensive and much-prized.
Boiled and dried awabi is called ganbao in Chinese cuisine, and large pieces of ganbao are very expensive and much-prized.

sen.j: 日本でも古来、内陸部で食べる鮑は羅鮑（身取り鮑）で殻から取った物を干し乾燥していた。
sen.e: In Japan, shucked abalone was traditionally eaten in inland areas and the meat taken out from the shell were hung out to dry.
In Japan, shucked abalone were traditionally eaten in inland areas and the meat taken out from the shell was hung out to dry.
In Japan, shucked abalone were traditionally eaten in inland areas and the meat taken out from the shell was hung out to dry.

sen.j: 高級な干し鮑の産地として、日本の青森県や岩手県が知られており、大間町産のもの（広東語で「禾麻鮑 オウマパーウ」）や、大船渡市吉浜産のもの（きっぴん鮑。「吉品鮑 カッパンパーウ」）は香港で非常に高値で取引されている。
sen.e: Aomori and Iwate Prefectures are well-known for production of high-grade dried abalone, and products from Oma-machi ("Oma Abalone") and those from Yoshihama, Ominato City ("Yoshihama Abalone") are sold at much inflated price in Hong Kong.

Aomori and Iwate Prefectures are well-known for the production of high-grade dried abalone, and products from Oma-machi ("Oma Abalone") and those from Yoshihama, Ominato City ("Yoshihama Abalone") sell for a high price in Hong Kong.

Aomori and Iwate Prefectures are well-known for the production of high-grade dried abalone, and products from Oma-machi ('Oma Abalone') and those from Yoshihama, Ominato City ('Yoshihama Abalone') sell for a high price in Hong Kong.

sen.j: 大きいほど高価になり、1斤（600g弱）当たりの頭数で、十頭鮑（乾燥品1つの重量が60g）などと呼ぶ。
sen.e: The larger a piece of bangao is, the more expensive it is; ganbao of a little less than 600g is called ten abalone (one dried product weighs 60g).
The larger a piece of ganbao is, the more expensive it is; one batch of ganbao of a little less than 600g is called "ten abalone" (one dried product weighs 60g).
The larger a piece of ganbao is, the more expensive it is; one batch of ganbao of a little less than 600g is called "ten abalone" (one dried product weighs 60g).

sen.j: 日本以外では、南アフリカ共和国などのものが比較的高級とされている。
sen.e: Other than Japanese products, dried abalone produced in the Republic of South Africa is regarded as relatively high-grade.
In addition to some Japanese products, dried abalone produced in the Republic of South Africa is regarded as relatively high-grade.
In addition to some Japanese products, dried abalone produced in the Republic of South Africa is regarded as relatively high-grade.

sen.j: 鮑(あわび)の肉を塩蔵し、煮て乾燥したものを「明鮑」といい、中国料理に用いられた。
sen.e: The meat of awabi salt-cured, stewed and dried is called "mingbao" and used for Chinese food.
The meat of awabi salt-cured, stewed and dried is called "mingbao" and used in Chinese cuisine.
The meat of awabi salt-cured, stewed and dried is called 'mingbao' and used in Chinese cuisine.

sen.j: その製造は複雑かつ細心の注意を要したものであった。
sen.e: The manufacturing process of mingbao is elaborated and requires extreme caution.
The manufacturing process of dried abalone is elaborate and requires extreme caution.
sen.cmt: Grammar. This section does not describe mingbao solely, but dried abalone as a whole as I understand it.
sen.e: The manufacturing process of dried abalone is elaborate and requires extreme caution.

sen.j: その工程は、除殻、加塩、洗浄、整形、煮熟、焙乾、二度煮、乾燥というふうになる。
sen.e: The process consists of shell removal, salting, washing, shaping, stewing, roasting and drying, second stewing and drying.
The process consists of shell removal, salting, washing, shaping, stewing, roasting and drying, a second stewing and finally drying.
The process consists of shell removal, salting, washing, shaping, stewing, roasting and drying, a second stewing and finally drying.

sen.j: 原料は、ふつう「まだか」という種類で、新鮮な損傷の無いものを用いる。
sen.e: The ingredient is generally giant abalone (Haliotis madaka) which is fresh and not damaged.
Generally only fresh and undamaged Giant abalone (Haliotis madaka) are used.
Generally only fresh and undamaged Giant abalone (Haliotis madaka) are used.

sen.j: 「貝起」で鰓を傷つけないようにしながら介殻を除去し、塩漬けをする。
sen.e: The shell is removed with the use of a shell knife so carefully as not to hurt the abalone and the meat is salted.
The shell is removed with the use of a shell knife carefully so as not to hurt the abalone, and the meat is salted.
The shell is removed with the use of a shell knife carefully so as not to hurt the abalone, and the meat is salted.

sen.j: その目的は塩味を付けるとともに洗浄を容易にするためである。
sen.e: The purpose is to give a salty taste as well as to make washing easier.
The purpose of this is to create a salty taste as well as to make the act of washing easier.
The purpose of this is to create a salty taste as well as to make the act of washing easier.

sen.j: 塩量は製品に大きく影響し、多すぎると、煮熟中に亀裂が生じやすくなり、しばしば表面に水膨ができる。
sen.e: Products are greatly influenced by the salt content; when salt is too much, the meat easily cracks during stewing and blisters are frequently produced on the surface.
The product is greatly influenced by the salt content; when too much salt is used the meat easily cracks during the stewing process and blisters are frequently produced on the surface.
The product is greatly influenced by the salt content; when too much salt is used the meat easily cracks during the stewing process and blisters are frequently produced on the surface.

sen.j: 塩が足りないと、肉面に黒点ができて肉が軟らかすぎて形が整わなくなる。
sen.e: When salt is too little, black spots appear on the surface and the meat is too soft to shape.
When too little salt is used black spots appear on the surface and the meat is too soft to shape.
When too little salt is used black spots appear on the surface and the meat is too soft to shape.

sen.j: 塩漬は殻を除いた生鮑を大、中および小に分けて、4斗入の樽に並べて塩をまいて漬け込む。
sen.e: In salting, pieces of raw abalone stripped of the shell are divided into three groups according to size, arranged in a 72 liter barrel, dusted with salt and left salted.

In the salting process, pieces of raw abalone from which the shell has been stripped are divided into three groups according to size, arranged in a 72 liter barrel, dusted with salt and left to absorb the salt.

In the salting process, pieces of raw abalone from which the shell has been stripped are divided into three groups according to size, arranged in a 72 liter barrel, dusted with salt and left to absorb the salt.

sen.j: 塩量は生肉10貫当たり、大粒なら6斤、中粒なら5斤、小粒なら4.5斤ほど。
sen.e: In the case of a large piece, about 3.6kg of salt is required for 37.5kg of meat, in the case of a middle-sized piece, about 3kg of salt, and in the case of small piece about 2.7kg of salt.
For large abalone about 3.6kg of salt is required for 37.5kg of meat, for middle-sized abalone about 3kg of salt, and about 2.7kg of salt for those of smaller size.
For large abalone about 3.6kg of salt is required for 37.5kg of meat, for middle-sized abalone about 3kg of salt, and about 2.7kg of salt for those of smaller size.

sen.j: 塩は表面に十分に付着するようにする。
sen.e: It must be ensured that salt attaches very well to the surface.
You must ensure that salt covers the surface completely.
You must ensure that salt covers the surface completely.

sen.j: 寒冷で塩が浸透しにくい時はいくらか増量し、温暖であれば減じる。
sen.e: In the low temperature, when salt is hard to sink in, the amount of salt is somewhat increased, and in the high temperature the amount is decreased.
At a low temperature, when it is difficult for the salt to be absorbed, the amount of salt used is somewhat increased, and at a high temperature the amount is decreased.
At a low temperature, when it is difficult for the salt to be absorbed, the amount of salt used is somewhat increased, and at a high temperature the amount is decreased.

sen.j: 塩漬けして翌朝取り出してその桶に淡水を入れ、草鞋ばきでその中に入り、残るくまなく踏んで肉面に付着した汚物、殻などを取り除く。
sen.e: On the next morning after salting, you pour fresh water into the tub, stepped into the tub wearing Zori (Japanese footwear sandals) and stamp all the meat in order to get rid of dirt and pieces of shell attached to the surface.

The morning after salting, you pour fresh water into the tub, step into the tub wearing zori (Japanese sandals) and step firmly on all the meat in order to get rid of any dirt or pieces of shell which may be attached to the surface.
sen.cmt: Grammar, word choice. The use of the term 'Japanese sandals' may be confusing to the reader. Perhaps 'straw sandals' may be more appropriate. Is this section describing the process in Japan, or generally?
sen.e: The morning after salting, you pour fresh water into the tub, step into the tub wearing zori (Japanese sandals) and step firmly on all the meat in order to get rid of any dirt or pieces of shell which may be attached to the surface.

sen.j: そののち数回にわたって水洗いし（一個一個、鮑面をこすり汚物を除く）、あらかじめ煮沸している手引き加減の釜に入れる。
sen.e: After that, the meat is washed with water (the surface of each piece of awabi should be rubbed and cleared of dirt) and put into an iron pot filled with water which is already boiled.
After that, the meat is washed with water (the surface of each awabi should be rubbed and cleared of dirt) and put into an iron pot filled with boiling water.
After that, the meat is washed with water (the surface of each awabi should be rubbed and cleared of dirt) and put into an iron pot filled with boiling water.

sen.j: この時、鮑はしだいに縮まり、または変形するから、常に整形をし、かつ、肉が釜の底に焦げ付かないように注意しながら煮熟する。
sen.e: In this process, as awabi gradually shrinks or changes shape, it should be constantly shaped, and stewed while care is taken not to make the meat burn to the bottom of the pot.
In this process, as the awabi gradually shrink and change in shape, they should be constantly reshaped and stewed, taking care that the meat does not burn on the bottom of the pot.
In this process, as the awabi gradually shrink and change in shape, they should be constantly reshaped and stewed, taking care that the meat does not burn on the bottom of the pot.

sen.j: およそ1.5時間後、釜の蓋をはずし、さらに3～4時間ほど煮熟し、掬い上げて陰干し、冷却する。
sen.e: After about 90 minutes, the lid of the pot is removed and the meat is further stewed for three to four hours, scooped up, dried in a dark place and cooled down.
After about ninety minutes, the lid of the pot is removed and the meat is further stewed for three to four hours, scooped up, dried in a dark place and cooled.
After about ninety minutes, the lid of the pot is removed and the meat is further stewed for three to four hours, scooped up, dried in a dark place and cooled.

sen.j: 肉が冷却すると焙炉にかけて乾燥する。
sen.e: The cooled-down meat is put into Hoiro (a kiln for drying and kneading tea leaves) and dried.
The cooled meat is put into a hoiro (a kiln usually used for drying and kneading tea leaves) and dried.
The cooled meat is put into a hoiro (a kiln usually used for drying and kneading tea leaves) and dried.

sen.j: これは「水抜き」といい、よく肉を反転して均一に火が通るようにする。
sen.e: This process is called "water removal," during which the meat should be rotated well in order to be cooked evenly.
This process is called "water removal," during which the meat should be rotated well in order to be cooked evenly.
This process is called 'water removal,' during which the meat should be rotated well in order to be cooked evenly.

sen.j: こうして適当なときに火から取り下ろし、放冷し、翌日、肉がなおやわらかなものに二番火を入れる。
sen.e: The meat is removed from the heat after some time, allowed to cool, and is heated again if the meat is still soft on the next day.
The meat is removed from the heat after some time, allowed to cool, and is heated again if the meat is still soft the next day.
The meat is removed from the heat after some time, allowed to cool, and is heated again if the meat is still soft the next day.

sen.j: 次には二度煮をおこない、前回の煮熟の不足を補い、かつ、形状を固定させる。
sen.e: Next, the meat is stewed again in order to make up for lack of the first stewing and to fix the form.
Next, the meat is stewed again in order to make up for the short time of the first stewing and to fix the form.
Next, the meat is stewed again in order to make up for the short time of the first stewing and to fix the form.

sen.j: 沸騰した釜に原料を再びいれ、湯が沸騰してきたら原料を掬い上げて蒸籠に並べ、風通しのよい日陰で放冷する。
sen.e: Again the ingredients are put into a pot filled with boiling water, and when the water boils the ingredients are scooped up, arranged on seiro (basket used for steaming food) and allowed to cool in the airy shade.

Again the abalone are put into a pot filled with boiling water, and when the water boils they are scooped out, arranged on seiro (baskets used for steaming food) and allowed to cool in the shade, in a place with good air circulation.

Again the abalone are put into a pot filled with boiling water, and when the water boils they are scooped out, arranged on seiro (baskets used for steaming food) and allowed to cool in the shade, in a place with good air circulation.

sen.j: 完全に放冷したらふたたび焙炉にかけてしばらく焙乾し、原料を握って我慢できないほどに熱が加えられれば取り下ろして放冷する。
sen.e: When they are completely cool, they are put into Hoiro again, roasted for some time until they become too hot to grasp, removed from the heat and allowed to cool.
When they are completely cool, they are put into the hoiro again, roasted for some time until they become too hot to touch, removed from the heat and allowed to cool.
When they are completely cool, they are put into the hoiro again, roasted for some time until they become too hot to touch, removed from the heat and allowed to cool.

sen.j: こうして日乾と焙乾をおおよそ晴天5～7日続けて、焙乾をやめ、日乾だけをおおよそ1ヶ月続けて完成とする。
sen.e: After five to seven sunny days of alternate sun-drying and roasting in an above-stated manner, roasting is stopped and only sun-drying is resumed; after about a month, mingbao is completed.
After five to seven sunny days of alternate sun-drying and roasting in the above-stated manner the roasting is stopped, the sun-drying continuing until after about a month the process is completed.
sen.cmt: Grammar, punctuation. I have assumed that this process refers to all dried abalone and not just mingbao.
sen.e: After five to seven sunny days of alternate sun-drying and roasting in the above-stated manner the roasting is stopped, the sun-drying continuing until after about a month the process is completed.

sen.j: 中国医学ではアワビ属のミミガイ、フクトコブシ、エゾアワビなどの貝殻を、「石决明」（せきけつめい）と称して、薬用にしてきた。
sen.e: In Chinese medicine, shells of Haliotis asinina, Haliotis diversicolor Reeve and Haliotis discus hannai (Abalone) are called "shijueming (sea-ear shell)" and have been used as medicine.
In Chinese medicine, the shells of Haliotis asinina, Haliotis diversicolor Reeve and Haliotis discus hannai (abalone) are called "shijueming" (sea-ear shells) and have been used as a medicine.
In Chinese medicine, the shells of Haliotis asinina, Haliotis diversicolor Reeve and Haliotis discus hannai (abalone) are called 'shijueming' (sea-ear shells) and have been used as a medicine.

sen.j: 「清肝明目」（せいかんめいもく）、即ち、肝機能を改善し、同時に目の機能を高める効果があるとする。
sen.e: They are supposed to have an effect of "clearing away liver-fire and treating eye disease," that is, an effect of improving liver function and enhancing eye function.
They are believed to have the effect of improving liver function and enhancing the health of the eye.
sen.cmt: Simplified to avoid confusion and repetition.
sen.e: They are believed to have the effect of improving liver function and enhancing the health of the eye.

sen.j: 主成分は炭酸カルシウムであるが、現在は中国においても日本においても局方には入っていない。
sen.e: They are composed mostly of calcium carbonate, and are not included in official drugs either in China or in Japan now.
They contain calcium carbonate, but are not treated as official drugs either in China or in Japan at the present time.
They contain calcium carbonate, but are not treated as official drugs either in China or in Japan at the present time.

sen.j: 貝殻をボタン (服飾)などに用いる。
sen.e: Shells are used as a button (garment).
The shells can be used as buttons for various garments.
The shells can be used as buttons for various garments.

sen.j: また、殻の裏側には非常に美しい真珠光沢があり、ごく薄く切り出したものを螺鈿細工などの工芸材料に用いる。
sen.e: The under side of a shell is covered with very beautiful, shiny mother-of-pearl and its extremely slim slice is used as materials for craftwork such as raden (shell inlay) work.
The under side of the shell is covered with very beautiful and shiny mother-of-pearl and extremely thin slices of this are used as material for craftwork such as raden (shell inlay) work.
The under side of the shell is covered with very beautiful and shiny mother-of-pearl and extremely thin slices of this are used as material for craftwork such as raden (shell inlay) work.

sen.j: また、殻の真珠層を利用して真珠の養殖に使われることもある。
sen.e: In addition, the mother-of-pearl of a shell is sometimes used for cultivation of pearls.
In addition, the mother-of-pearl of the shell is sometimes used in the cultivation of pearls.
In addition, the mother-of-pearl of the shell is sometimes used in the cultivation of pearls.

sen.j: 漁業
sen.e: Fishery
Fishing industry
Fishing industry

sen.j: 養殖の稚貝には餌として、褐藻類を与えるものと、人工飼料やアラメ等を与えるものがある。
sen.e: Some young farm-raised shellfishes are fed with Phaeophyceae, and some are given artificial diet and Eisenia bicyclis.
Some young farm-raised shellfish are fed with Phaeophyceae, a type of brown algae, others are fed with Eisenia bicyclis, a type of seaweed, or are given an artificial diet.
Some young farm-raised shellfish are fed with Phaeophyceae, a type of brown algae, others are fed with Eisenia bicyclis, a type of seaweed, or are given an artificial diet.

sen.j: 前者は稚貝放流事業で放流される物が殆どで成長した物でも稚貝が天然物か否か全く見分けがつかない。
sen.e: In most cases the former are released as a part of young shellfish releasing activities, and it is impossible to tell whether the young shellfish was a natural product or not when you see a grown-up shellfish.

In most cases those fed on algae are released as a part of juvenile shellfish releasing activities, and it is impossible to tell from appearance alone whether an adult shellfish was born in the wild or artificially cultivated.

In most cases those fed on algae are released as a part of juvenile shellfish releasing activities, and it is impossible to tell from appearance alone whether an adult shellfish was born in the wild or artificially cultivated.

sen.j: 後者は、殻が青～緑色になっており、成貝となってもこの色が消えることはない。
sen.e: The latter have blue to green shells, and this color will not disappear after the shellfish has grown up.
Those fed on seaweed or fed an artificial diet develop blue or green shells, and this color remains even when the shellfish has reached maturity.
Those fed on seaweed or fed an artificial diet develop blue or green shells, and this color remains even when the shellfish has reached maturity.

sen.j: そのため、殻頂部の色はアワビが天然ものか養殖放流ものかを見分ける印として用いられ、グリーンマークとよばれる。
sen.e: That is why the color of the top of a shell is called "Green Mark," used as a sign to tell whether awabi is a natural product or a farm-raised and released one.
That is why the color of the top of the shell is called the "Green Mark," used as a sign to discern whether the awabi is a natural product or a farm-raised one released into the wild.

sen.j: 鮑玉は宝飾だけではなく、漢方薬として用いられていたと見られる。

Abalone pearls are believed to have been used not only as jewelry but also as a Chinese herbal medicine.
Abalone pearls are believed to have been used not only as jewelry but also as a Chinese herbal medicine.

sen.j: 特に貝類の真珠層には解熱作用があり、近年まで小粒の物は漢方薬として用いられていたが、現在、大半は入手しやすいアコヤガイ真珠の物に置きかわっている。
sen.e: Smaller pieces of abalone were used as a Chinese herbal drug until recently because the pearl layer of seashells has an antipyretic effect, but today they are replaced by Akoya pearls which are easier to acquire.

sen.j: 現在の真珠養殖が始まる以前、この鮑玉が日本の真珠産業であったと見られる。
sen.e: Abalone pearls are believed to have been the only pearl produced in Japan before pearls started to be cultivated in today's style.
Abalone pearls are believed to have been the only pearls produced in Japan before pearls started to be cultivated using modern methods.
Abalone pearls are believed to have been the only pearls produced in Japan before pearls started to be cultivated using modern methods.

sen.j: 伊勢の海人 朝な夕なに 潜つぐ 鮑の片思いにして -- 故事成語「アワビの貝の片想い（磯のアワビの片思い）」の元となった歌
sen.e: A male diver of Ise dives into the sea every morning and evening because he is in one-sided love just like awabi -- a song from which an idiom "one-sided love of awabi (in the seashore)"originates.

A male diver from Ise dives into the sea every morning and evening because he is in one-sided love just like the awabi -- this is the song from which the idiom "one-sided love of awabi (on the seashore)" is said to originate.

sen.j: 熨斗鮑（のしあわび）
sen.e: Noshi abalone
Noshi abalone
Noshi abalone

sen.j: 細く切った鮑を乾燥させた物で、祝い事に配られる。
sen.e: Thin strips of dried abalone which are distributed at the time of a celebration.
Thin strips of dried abalone are distributed at the time of a celebration.
Thin strips of dried abalone are distributed at the time of a celebration.

sen.j: 伊勢神宮での神事に使用される国崎（三重県鳥羽市国崎町）産の熨斗鰒にちなみ、御師が縁起物として配りだしたのが一般に広まったきっかけである。
sen.e: They became popular after onshi (low-ranking Shinto priests) began to distribute them as a lucky charm, in tribute to noshi abalone produced in Kuzaki-cho, Toba City, Mie Prefecture which was used in Shinto rituals in Ise Jingu Shrine.

They became popular after onshi (low-ranking Shinto priests) began to distribute them as lucky charms, in tribute to the noshi abalone produced in Kuzaki-cho, Toba City, Mie Prefecture which were used in Shinto rituals in Ise Jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 進物にも熨斗鮑を添付するのが正式であるが、次第に簡略化して熨斗鮑を図案化した物を印刷した熨斗紙で済ませることが多くなった。
sen.e: Formally sinmotsu (gift) should be accompanied by noshi abalone, but as a result of gradual simplification, noshigami (wrapping paper for a present), on which stylized noshi abalone is painted, has come to be used instead of noshi abalone.

Formally shinmotsu (gifts) were usually accompanied by noshi abalone, but as a result of gradual simplification, noshigami (wrapping paper for a present) with painted stylized noshi abalone have come to be used instead of the real thing.

sen.j: 常に相手を思っている状態のことを表したことわざで、アワビはアサリやシジミのように二枚貝ではないため、ピッタリの貝が無く、相手を常に思う状態であるということに例えた言葉である。
sen.e: This proverb represents the situation in which one always thinks of the other, based on the assumption that awabi, unlike bivalves such as asari and corbicula clams, has no matching shell and always longs for a partner.

Bao Shuya, who wrote "The Friendship Between Guan and Bao", is a famous individual with that family name.
